tags.brief: A styled dropdown (select) component.
tags.intro:
Renders a `<select>` like element styled according to theme context. Supports multiple sizes
and validation states.
tags.example:
import { Select } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Select s defaultValue={'2'}>
  <SelectItem value={'1'}>1</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value={'2'}>2</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value={'3'}>3</SelectItem>
</Select>

xs.description: Extra small size variant for the select.

s.description: Small size variant for the select.

m.description: Medium size variant for the select.

l.description: Large size variant for the select.

itemStyle.description: Custom styles applied to each `SelectItem` within the dropdown.

selectValue.description: The initial selected value of the select component.

onSelectChange.description:
Callback fired when the selected value changes.
Receives the new value as a string or number.

tags.brief: An individual selectable item used within the Select dropdown.
tags.intro:
Displays a styled item that responds to click and keyboard interactions. Automatically highlights when selected.
Must be used inside a `Select` component to inherit context.
tags.example:
import { Select, SelectItem } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Select>
  <SelectItem value="1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  <SelectItem value="2">Option 2</SelectItem>
</Select>

tags.brief: A customizable button component that supports size and color variants.
tags.intro: Supports four sizes (xs, s, m, l) and four variants (primary, neutral, warn, error).
tags.example:
import { Button } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Button>Default</Button>
<Button primary xs>Confirm</Button>
<Button error l>Delete</Button>

xs.description: Extra small button. Sizing depends on theme.

s.description: Small button. Sizing depends on theme.

m.description: Medium button. Sizing depends on theme.

l.description: Large button. Sizing depends on theme.

primary.description: If true, applies the primary color style.

neutral.description: If true, applies the neutral color style.

warn.description: If true, applies the warning color style.

error.description: If true, applies the error color style.

tags.brief: A square-shaped button designed to contain only an icon, not text.
tags.intro:
Renders a circular or square icon-only button with predefined size variants.
Supports four sizes and applies consistent styling from theme context.
tags.example:
import { IconButton } from '@lite-u/ui'
import { Icon } from '@lite-u/icons'

<IconButton s onClick={handleClick}>
  <Icon name="search" />
</IconButton>

xs.description: Applies the extra small size variant to the button.

s.description: Applies the small size variant to the button.

m.description: Applies the small size variant to the button.

l.description: Applies the large size variant to the button.

tags.brief: A stylized input field supporting text and number types with size and color variants.
tags.intro:
Renders either a text or number input with support for theming, sizing, and validation states.
Styling is pulled from the Lite UI theme context and adjusted according to provided props.
tags.example:
import { Input } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Input placeholder="Your name" />
<Input number step={0.1} error />
<Input label="Username" s primary />

label.description: Optional label to display as the `<label>`.

xs.description: Extra small size variant for the input.

s.description: Small size variant for the input.

m.description: Medium size variant for the input.

l.description: Large size variant for the input.

number.description: If true, renders a number input instead of a text input.

primary.description: Applies primary styling to the input field.

warn.description: Applies warning styling to the input field.

error.description: Applies error styling to the input field.

neutral.description: Applies neutral styling to the input field.

labelStyle.description: Inline styles to customize the label.

tags.brief: Represents a hyperlink component with consistent styling and optional behavior controls.
tags.intro: Renders a styled `<a>` element for internal or external navigation, supporting accessibility and customization options.
tags.example:
import { Link } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Link href="https://example.com" target="_blank">
    Visit Example
</Link>

fw.description: If true, the link will take up the full width of its container.

fh.description: If true, the link will take up the full height of its container.

tags.brief: Animates itself.
tags.intro:
To apply animations to elements typically requires external libraries or CSS files. For simplicity and control, `Transition` implements inline animations, putting all animation-related properties under your direct management.

\
✅️ `Tips`: Always remember: `Transition` is the direct receiver of the animation and serves as the true boundary between the wrapped component and its parent. If you wrap a component with `Transition`, be sure to apply the corresponding styles directly to `Transition`.

visible.description:
Whether the transition should be visible.
If true, transition animates to `to` styles; otherwise, animates to `from`.

from.description:
The initial styles before transition starts.
Can contain raw CSS values or detailed timing configurations.

to.description:
The target styles to animate toward when `visible` is true.
Can contain raw CSS values or detailed timing configurations.

transformOrigin.description:
CSS `transform-origin` value for the transition.
Controls the origin point of scaling/rotating transforms.

effect.description: Default timing function for all transitions unless overridden per-property.

duration.description: Default duration in milliseconds for entering transitions unless overridden per-property.

exitDuration.description: Default duration in milliseconds for leaving transitions unless overridden per-property.

delay.description: Default delay in milliseconds before starting the transition unless overridden per-property.

onAnimationEntered.description: Called when the enter transition finishes.

onAnimationExited.description: Called when the exit transition finishes.

onAnimationEnterCancel.description: Called if the enter transition is canceled (e.g., unmount during enter).

onAnimationExitCancel.description: Called if the exit transition is canceled (e.g., re-enter during exit).

tags.brief: A flexible modal dialog component that overlays content on top of the existing UI.
tags.intro:
Renders children inside a centered modal container with a customizable backdrop and style.
Supports optional backdrop click handling.
tags.example:
import { Modal } from '@lite-u/ui' setOpen(false)}>
Modal Content

onBackdropClick.description: Callback invoked when the backdrop is clicked.

backdropBg.description: Background color of the backdrop overlay.

tags.brief: A flexible container component used to group and visually separate content within the layout.
tags.intro:
Provides a styled block container with customizable margin, padding, and background options.
Commonly used to structure and emphasize content sections in a UI.
tags.example:
import { Panel } from '@lite-u/ui'

Section Title

This is a section of content within a panel.

xs.description: If true, sets the panel size to extra small (`xs`).

s.description: If true, sets the panel size to small (`sm`).

m.description: If true, sets the panel size to medium (`md`).

l.description: If true, sets the panel size to large (`lg`).

head.description: The head part displayed in the panel header.

headStyle.description: Optional custom styles for the head container.

contentStyle.description: Optional custom styles for the panel content container.

tags.brief: A horizontal flex container with shorthand alignment and spacing props.
tags.intro:
A layout component built on top of `Flex`, providing horizontal flow and useful alignment helpers like `start`, `center`, `stretch`, `wrap`, and `space`.
Supports extended `ContainerProps`.
tags.example: import { Container } from '@lite-u/ui' 1 2 3

start.description: Align items to the start vertically.

center.description: Align items to the center vertically.

stretch.description: Stretch items to fill the container vertically.

end.description: Align items to the end vertically.

wrap.description: If true, allows child elements to wrap onto multiple lines.

jc.description: Justify content to the center horizontally.

js.description: Justifies children to the start horizontally.

je.description: Justifies children to the end horizontally.

between.description: Justify content with space between items.

border.description: If true, applies a 1px solid border with the specified border color.

box.description: If true, applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the container.

tl.description: If true, aligns text to the left.

tc.description: If true, aligns text to the center.

tr.description: If true, aligns text to the right.

fz.description: Font size of the container text.

ib.description: If true, sets display to inline-block.

abs.description: If true, sets position to absolute.

rela.description: If true, sets position to relative.

fixed.description: If true, sets position to fixed.

tags.brief: A flexible vertical layout container built on top of the Flex component.
tags.intro:
Arranges children in a column direction using Flexbox. Supports alignment props
like `start`, `center`, `end`, and spacing between items using the `space` prop.
tags.example:
import { Column } from '@lite-u/ui' // Col is an alias of Column import { Col } from '@lite-u/ui'
Item 1
Item 2

start.description: Aligns children to the start of the column (left by default).

center.description: Aligns children to the center of the column.

stretch.description: Stretches children to fill the column width.

end.description: Aligns children to the end of the column (right by default).

space.description: Defines spacing between children using the CSS `gap` property.

wrap.description: If true, allows child elements to wrap onto multiple columns.

around.description: Justifies children with space around them.

between.description: Justifies children with space between them.

jc.description: Justifies children to the center vertically.

js.description: Justifies children to the start vertically.

je.description: Justifies children to the end vertically.

border.description: If true, applies a 1px solid border with the specified border color.

box.description: If true, applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the container.

tl.description: If true, aligns text to the left.

tc.description: If true, aligns text to the center.

tr.description: If true, aligns text to the right.

fz.description: Font size of the container text.

ib.description: If true, sets display to inline-block.

abs.description: If true, sets position to absolute.

rela.description: If true, sets position to relative.

fixed.description: If true, sets position to fixed.

start.description: Aligns children to the start of the column (left by default).

center.description: Aligns children to the center of the column.

stretch.description: Stretches children to fill the column width.

end.description: Aligns children to the end of the column (right by default).

space.description: Defines spacing between children using the CSS `gap` property.

wrap.description: If true, allows child elements to wrap onto multiple columns.

around.description: Justifies children with space around them.

between.description: Justifies children with space between them.

jc.description: Justifies children to the center vertically.

js.description: Justifies children to the start vertically.

je.description: Justifies children to the end vertically.

border.description: If true, applies a 1px solid border with the specified border color.

box.description: If true, applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the container.

tl.description: If true, aligns text to the left.

tc.description: If true, aligns text to the center.

tr.description: If true, aligns text to the right.

fz.description: Font size of the container text.

ib.description: If true, sets display to inline-block.

abs.description: If true, sets position to absolute.

rela.description: If true, sets position to relative.

fixed.description: If true, sets position to fixed.

box.description: If true, applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the container.

tl.description: If true, aligns text to the left.

tc.description: If true, aligns text to the center.

tr.description: If true, aligns text to the right.

fz.description: Font size of the container text.

border.description: If true, applies a 1px solid border with the specified border color.

ib.description: If true, sets display to inline-block.

abs.description: If true, sets position to absolute.

rela.description: If true, sets position to relative.

fixed.description: If true, sets position to fixed.

tags.brief: Renders a heading (`<h1>`–`<h6>`) with automatic theming and optional sticky positioning.
tags.intro:
Automatically selects a heading level (h1–h6) based on the given boolean props.
Styles the heading with a themed font size and margin. Supports sticky behavior for fixed headers.
tags.example:
import { Title } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Title h2 sticky>Section Title</Title>

sticky.description: Makes the heading position sticky at the top of its container.

h1.description: If true, renders an h1 element.

h2.description: If true, renders an h2 element.

h3.description: If true, renders an h3 element.

h4.description: If true, renders an h4 element.

h5.description: If true, renders an h5 element.

h6.description: If true, renders an h6 element.

tags.brief:
Renders a styled `

` tag with configurable font size, color, alignment, and word-break behavior.
tags.intro:
Applies theming defaults for spacing and base typography, while allowing per-instance customization
for text alignment, font size, color, and word-breaking strategy.
tags.example:
import { Paragraph } from '@lite-u/ui'
P is an alias of Paragraph
import { P } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Paragraph size={14} textColor="gray" center>
  This is a centered paragraph with custom styling.
</Paragraph>

size.description: Custom font size for the paragraph text.
Custom font size for the paragraph text.

tags.brief: A vertical stack layout component designed for navigation or grouped UI items.
tags.intro:
Arranges its children in a column using Flexbox with configurable spacing.
Useful for building vertical menus, lists, or grouped controls. Automatically
sets cursor to pointer and full width, promoting interactive layout.
tags.example:
import { Menu, MenuItem } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Menu space={12}>
  <MenuItem>Item 1</MenuItem>
  <MenuItem>Item 2</MenuItem>
</Menu>

space.description: Vertical spacing (gap) between children, in pixels.

tags.brief: A flexible interactive item used within menus or lists, with optional size variants and hover transitions.
tags.intro:
Applies consistent dimensions and padding based on selected size (`xs`, `s`, `m`, `l`),
and shows a transition effect on hover. Integrates theming from Lite UI context.
tags.example:
import { MenuItem } from '@lite-u/ui'

<MenuItem m hoverStyle={{ backgroundColor: 'lightgray' }}>
  Settings
</MenuItem>

xs.description: Renders the item in extra-small size.

s.description: Renders the item in small size.

m.description: Renders the item in medium size.

l.description: Renders the item in large size.

hoverStyle.description: CSS styles to apply on hover transition.

hoverEnterDuration.description: Duration of the hover transition entering, in milliseconds.

hoverLeaveDuration.description: Duration of the hover transition leaving, in milliseconds.

tags.brief: Displays a floating label with helpful information when the user hovers over or focuses on the target element.
tags.intro: Renders a customizable tooltip using React Portals for positioning and transition animations. It calculates the correct position based on the specified direction and adjusts dynamically if the target element moves.
tags.example:
import { Tooltip } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Tooltip title="Hello" placement="t">
  <button>Hover me</button>
</Tooltip>

bgColor.description: The background color of the tooltip. Defaults to a neutral color.

textColor.description: The text color of the tooltip. Defaults to a readable color.

placement.description:
The placement of the tooltip relative to its children. Can be one of:
`t` , `r` , `b` , `l` , `tl` , `tr` , `bl` , `br`

animationEnterDuration.description: Duration of the transition entering, in milliseconds.

animationExitDuration.description: Duration of the transition leaving, in milliseconds.

box.description: If true, applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the container.

tl.description: If true, aligns text to the left.

tc.description: If true, aligns text to the center.

tr.description: If true, aligns text to the right.

fz.description: Font size of the container text.

border.description: If true, applies a 1px solid border with the specified border color.

ib.description: If true, sets display to inline-block.

abs.description: If true, sets position to absolute.

rela.description: If true, sets position to relative.

fixed.description: If true, sets position to fixed.

tags.brief: A flexible layout and style container that adapts to various UI layout needs.
tags.intro:
Provides dynamic box, margin, padding, overflow, and size styling through a rich set of shorthand props.
Useful as a base layout block across components or pages.
`Con` is an Alias of Container
tags.example:
import { Container } from '@lite-u/ui' // Con is an Alias of Container import { Con } from '@lite-u/ui'

Content

box.description: If true, applies `box-sizing: border-box` to the container.

tl.description: If true, aligns text to the left.

tc.description: If true, aligns text to the center.

tr.description: If true, aligns text to the right.

fz.description: Font size of the container text.

border.description: If true, applies a 1px solid border with the specified border color.

ib.description: If true, sets display to inline-block.

abs.description: If true, sets position to absolute.

rela.description: If true, sets position to relative.

fixed.description: If true, sets position to fixed.

tags.brief: A collapsible container that shows or hides its content with a smooth transition.
tags.intro:
Renders a toggleable header and a content area that expands or collapses with animation.
Useful for accordion-like UI components or sections where content needs to be shown/hidden on demand.
tags.example:
import Collapse from '@lite-u/ui'

This content is hidden or shown based on the collapse state.

head.description: The clickable header element that toggles the collapse.

headStyle.description: Inline styles applied to the clickable header element.

contentStyle.description: Inline styles applied to the collapsible content container.

duration.description: Duration of the enter transition in milliseconds.

exitDuration.description: Duration of the leave transition in milliseconds.

onToggle.description: Callback fired when the collapse is toggled. Receives the new open state.

tags.brief: A drag-and-drop file drop zone with file type validation and customizable events.
tags.intro:
In React, applying visual cues during drag-over can sometimes cause flickering—especially when styles update frequently. The Drop component simplifies handling such interactions by managing drag-over feedback smoothly and supporting MIME-type restrictions. It also provides hooks for custom logic when files are dropped, making it an easy and reliable way to implement drag-and-drop functionality.

\
⚠️ `Caution`: Safari `CANNOT` detect files during the drag phase, so use `onDropped` ONLY for any functionality that needs to work reliably across all browsers.
tags.example:
import { Drop } from '@lite-u/ui' {}) onDropped={(e, isValid) => console.log(e, isValid)} >

Drop image files here

accepts.description: List of accepted MIME types. Wildcards like 'image/*' are supported.

onDragIsOver.description: Callback triggered when a valid drag enters the drop zone.

onDragIsLeave.description:
Callback triggered when dragging leaves the drop zone.

>Note: Safari does not reliably detect dragged files, and the onDragIsOver event is not supported in this browser.

onDropped.description:
Callback triggered when a file is dropped.
Provides the event and a flag indicating file type validity.

tags.brief: Provides notification context and renders toasts with animation and auto-dismiss(optional) behavior.
tags.intro:
Wraps an application with a notification system. Allows components to trigger toast messages
with customizable content, type, and duration. Renders floating notifications using portals
with enter/exit animations, and removes them after a timeout(optional).

tags.brief: A simple and easy-to-use table component with a minimal design.
tags.intro: Table accepts `TableRow` Component as children only
tags.example: import { Table, TableRow } from '@lite-u/ui' th cell 0 th cell 1 td cell 0 td cell 1

xs.description: Render the table with extra small (`xs`) size styling.

s.description: Render the table with small (`s`) size styling.

m.description: Render the table with medium (`s`) size styling.

l.description: Render the table with large (`l`) size styling.

fw.description: Whether the table should take up the full width of its parent

fh.description: Whether the table should take up the full height of its parent

fixed.description: Whether the [tableLayout](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/table-layout) should be set to `fixed`

rowStyle.description: Convenience way to style all table rows

rowHoverStyle.description: Convenience way to style Hovered body rows

tags.brief: Represents a table row for use within the Table component.
tags.intro:
Renders a styled `<tr>` element with automatically applied context-based row and cell styling.

Can optionally render as a header row using the `head` prop.

TableRow with `head` prop: recognized as a `thead` row

TableRow without `head` prop: recognized as a `tbody` row

TableRow doesn’t require `td`(or `th`) — its children are automatically wrapped in <td>(or `th`) tags.
tags.example:
import { Table, TableRow } from '@lite-u/ui'

th cell 0

th cell 1
td cell 0

td cell 1

head.description: If true, renders the row using `<th>` elements instead of `<td>`, and wrap into `<thead>` rather than `<tbody>`.

tags.brief: A hover-triggered wrapper that reveals content based on mouse interactions.
tags.intro:
Wraps `HoverHead` and `HoverBody` components to provide tooltip or popover-like functionality.
It manages visibility and optional persistence of content based on hover state, with customizable delay and trigger behavior.
tags.example:
import { Hover, HoverHead, HoverBody } from '@lite-u/ui'

<Hover delay={200} persistMode>
  <HoverHead>Hover me</HoverHead>
  <HoverBody>This content shows on hover</HoverBody>
</Hover>

delay.description: Delay in milliseconds before hiding the hover content after mouse leaves.

onlyTriggerByHead.description:
If true, hover effects are triggered only when hovering over the `HoverHead` element,
and `HoverBody` will disappear when the mouse leaves the `HoverHead`.

persistMode.description:
Enables persistent display mode, where hover state is managed logically and content is not removed from the DOM,
but instead controlled via display (display: none).
